poem:
Title: Egrets of Somerset

Life shifts, the egret finds a home
in Somerset's plain. Tropical tempest,
now England's refrain. An icy breath
no bar to this visitor's feathery claim.
White plumes prance on cow's back,
flourish in ill-met rain. A hundred
in number, they dance with time,
a testament to climate's fickle rhyme.
Who are we to challenge such divine design?
